p: Antiviral activity towards the Ebola virus (EBOV) of fluphenazine was analyzed by Johansen et al. (2015). The concentration of fluphenazine which caused 50% inhibition of host viability (without virus) were 5.54 ± 0.19 and 3.05 ± 1.68 μM for uninfected Vero E6 and HepG2 host cells, respectively. Interestingly, the EC 50 value for viral infection was not calculated. The Authors also showed that the fluphenazine concentration of 10 μM strongly (>90%) inhibits EBOV-VLP entry into SNB19 cells ( Johansen et al., 2015).
